org.jruyi.core

Interface ITcpClientConfiguration

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    ITcpConnPoolConfiguration

    public interface ITcpClientConfiguration
    This interface defines methods to configure a TCP client service.
    Since:
    2.2

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void apply()
      Applies this configuration to the associated TCP client service.
      int connectTimeoutInSeconds()
      Returns the timeout in seconds on establishing a TCP connection
      ITcpClientConfiguration connectTimeoutInSeconds(int connectTimeoutInSeconds)
      Sets the timeout in seconds on establishing a TCP connection.
      java.lang.String host()
      Returns the hostname or address of remote peer.
      java.lang.Boolean keepAlive()
      Returns whether to set socket option SO_KEEPALIVE.
      ITcpClientConfiguration keepAlive(java.lang.Boolean keepAlive)
      Sets whether to set socket option SO_KEEPALIVE.
      java.lang.Boolean oobInline()
      Returns whether to enable OOBINLINE(receipt of TCP urgent data), or null if not configured.
      ITcpClientConfiguration oobInline(java.lang.Boolean oobInline)
      Sets whether to enable OOBINLINE(receipt of TCP urgent data).
      int[] performancePreferences()
      Returns the performance preferences(connection-time, latency and bandwidth in order) to set, or null if not configured.
      ITcpClientConfiguration performancePreferences(int connectionTime, int latency, int bandwidth)
      Sets the performance preferences.
      int port()
      Returns the port.
      int readTimeoutInSeconds()
      Returns the timeout in seconds on reading.
      ITcpClientConfiguration readTimeoutInSeconds(int readTimeoutInSeconds)
      Sets the timeout in seconds on reading.
      java.lang.Integer recvBufSize()
      Returns the socket buffer size for receiving, or null if not configured.
      ITcpClientConfiguration recvBufSize(java.lang.Integer recvBufSize)
      Sets the number of bytes used to set the socket option SO_RCVBUF.
      boolean reuseAddr()
      Returns whether address is reused.
      ITcpClientConfiguration reuseAddr(boolean reuseAddr)
      Sets true to allow to reuse addresses.
      java.lang.Integer sendBufSize()
      Returns the socket buffer size for sending, or null if not configured.
      ITcpClientConfiguration sendBufSize(java.lang.Integer sendBufSize)
      Sets the number of bytes used to set the socket option SO_SNDBUF.
      java.lang.Integer soLinger()
      Returns how many seconds to linger for as configured.
      ITcpClientConfiguration soLinger(java.lang.Integer soLinger)
      Sets the seconds to linger for.
      java.lang.Boolean tcpNoDelay()
      Returns whether to disable Nagle's Algorithm, or null if not configured
      ITcpClientConfiguration tcpNoDelay(java.lang.Boolean tcpNoDelay)
      Sets whether to disable Nagle's Algorithm.
      long throttle()
      Returns the throttle.
      ITcpClientConfiguration throttle(long throttle)
      Sets the throttle.
      java.lang.Integer trafficClass()
      Returns the traffic class or type-of-service octet to be set in the IP header, or null if not configured.
      ITcpClientConfiguration trafficClass(java.lang.Integer trafficClass)
      Sets the traffic class or type-of-service octet to be set in the IP header.
      ITcpClientConfiguration unsetPerformancePreferences()
      Unsets the performance preferences.

        ITcpClientConfiguration throttle(long throttle)
        Sets the throttle.
        Parameters:
        throttle - the throttle to set
        Returns:
        this configuration
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the specified throttle is less than -1

      • connectTimeoutInSeconds

        int connectTimeoutInSeconds()
        Returns the timeout in seconds on establishing a TCP connection
        Returns:
        the connect timeout in seconds

      • connectTimeoutInSeconds

        ITcpClientConfiguration connectTimeoutInSeconds(int connectTimeoutInSeconds)
        Sets the timeout in seconds on establishing a TCP connection. Sets 0 to never time out.
        Parameters:
        connectTimeoutInSeconds - the timeout to set
        Returns:
        this configuration
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the specified connectTimeoutInSeconds is negative

      • readTimeoutInSeconds

        int readTimeoutInSeconds()
        Returns the timeout in seconds on reading.
        Returns:
        the read timeout in seconds

      • readTimeoutInSeconds

        ITcpClientConfiguration readTimeoutInSeconds(int readTimeoutInSeconds)
        Sets the timeout in seconds on reading. Sets 0 to not expect a response. Sets -1 to never time out.
        Parameters:
        readTimeoutInSeconds - the timeout to set
        Returns:
        this configuration
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the specified readTimeoutInSeconds is less than -1

      • reuseAddr

        boolean reuseAddr()
        Returns whether address is reused.
        Returns:
        true if address is reused, otherwise false

      • reuseAddr

        ITcpClientConfiguration reuseAddr(boolean reuseAddr)
        Sets true to allow to reuse addresses.
        Parameters:
        reuseAddr - indicates whether to reuse addresses
        Returns:
        this configuration

      • keepAlive

        java.lang.Boolean keepAlive()
        Returns whether to set socket option SO_KEEPALIVE.
        Returns:
        true if SO_KEEPALIVE will be set, false if will not, null if not set

      • keepAlive

        ITcpClientConfiguration keepAlive(java.lang.Boolean keepAlive)
        Sets whether to set socket option SO_KEEPALIVE. Sets null to not set the socket option SO_KEEPALIVE.
        Parameters:
        keepAlive - indicates whether to set socket option SO_KEEPALIVE
        Returns:
        this configuration

      • soLinger

        java.lang.Integer soLinger()
        Returns how many seconds to linger for as configured.
        Returns:
        seconds to linger for if configured

      • soLinger

        ITcpClientConfiguration soLinger(java.lang.Integer soLinger)
        Sets the seconds to linger for. Sets null to not set the socket option SO_LINGER. behavior.
        Parameters:
        soLinger - the seconds to linger for
        Returns:
        this configuration
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the specified soLinger is negative

      • recvBufSize

        java.lang.Integer recvBufSize()
        Returns the socket buffer size for receiving, or null if not configured.
        Returns:
        the socket buffer size for receiving

      • recvBufSize

        ITcpClientConfiguration recvBufSize(java.lang.Integer recvBufSize)
        Sets the number of bytes used to set the socket option SO_RCVBUF. Sets null to not set the socket option SO_RCVBUF.
        Parameters:
        recvBufSize - the maximum socket receive buffer in bytes
        Returns:
        this configuration
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the specified recvBufSize is less than 1

      • sendBufSize

        java.lang.Integer sendBufSize()
        Returns the socket buffer size for sending, or null if not configured.
        Returns:
        the socket buffer size for sending

      • sendBufSize

        ITcpClientConfiguration sendBufSize(java.lang.Integer sendBufSize)
        Sets the number of bytes used to set the socket option SO_SNDBUF. Sets null to not set the socket option SO_SNDBUF.
        Parameters:
        sendBufSize - the maximum socket send buffer in bytes
        Returns:
        this configuration
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the specified sendBufSize is less than 1

      • tcpNoDelay

        java.lang.Boolean tcpNoDelay()
        Returns whether to disable Nagle's Algorithm, or null if not configured
        Returns:
        true if to disable Nagle's Algorithm, false if not to, or null if not configured

      • tcpNoDelay

        ITcpClientConfiguration tcpNoDelay(java.lang.Boolean tcpNoDelay)
        Sets whether to disable Nagle's Algorithm. Sets null to not configure.
        Parameters:
        tcpNoDelay - indicates whether to disable Nagle's Algorithm
        Returns:
        this configuration

      • trafficClass

        java.lang.Integer trafficClass()
        Returns the traffic class or type-of-service octet to be set in the IP header, or null if not configured.
        Returns:
        the traffic class or type-of-service octet

      • trafficClass

        ITcpClientConfiguration trafficClass(java.lang.Integer trafficClass)
        Sets the traffic class or type-of-service octet to be set in the IP header. Sets null to not configure.
        Parameters:
        trafficClass - the traffic class or type-of-service octet to be set in the IP header
        Returns:
        this configuration

      • oobInline

        java.lang.Boolean oobInline()
        Returns whether to enable OOBINLINE(receipt of TCP urgent data), or null if not configured.
        Returns:
        true if to enable OOBINLINE, false if not to, or null if not configured

      • oobInline

        ITcpClientConfiguration oobInline(java.lang.Boolean oobInline)
        Sets whether to enable OOBINLINE(receipt of TCP urgent data). Sets null to not configure.
        Parameters:
        oobInline - indicates whether to enable OOBINLINE
        Returns:
        this configuration

      • performancePreferences

        int[] performancePreferences()
        Returns the performance preferences(connection-time, latency and bandwidth in order) to set, or null if not configured.
        Returns:
        the performance preferences to set

      • performancePreferences

        ITcpClientConfiguration performancePreferences(int connectionTime,
                                             int latency,
                                             int bandwidth)
        Sets the performance preferences.
        Parameters:
        connectionTime - indicates the relative importance of short connection time
        latency - indicates the relative importance of low latency
        bandwidth - indicates the relative importance of high bandwidth
        Returns:
        this configuration

      • unsetPerformancePreferences

        ITcpClientConfiguration unsetPerformancePreferences()
        Unsets the performance preferences.
        Returns:
        this configuration

      • apply

        void apply()
           throws java.lang.Throwable
        Applies this configuration to the associated TCP client service.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable - if any error happens
